metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32551 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would followsymbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-15package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apport package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24').
